data.text: For me, this app has been a great help! Whether scanning QR codes or UPC barcodes, I've had no issues with reading them, or reading them accurately would be a better way of describing the experience that I've had with the app. It really speeds the process of item listing in online auction sites as well.......

Works great. Just as long as you know the difference between the link and the advertisements. It is a bit deceptive. The app has a large green open button, clicking on that open button takes you to the add. The actual link that has been scanned is at the top of the screen. It is deceptive in that manner. If you are aware of it, you won't have any trouble with it. For a free QR and Barcode scanner it preforms exactly as it should. I can deal with add's for a quality app. Good job

Works great. I haven't tried every code scanner. But I tried a lot that were nothing but problems. This one does as discribed. Ads are on the bottom of the screen and don't adversely affect your ability to scan barcodes, and look at information on the internet about the item scanned. It works, as discribed. The app developer should get props for a integrity and not wasting my time. I found no " new problems, or strange phone behavior" no abuse of my data. I am definitely going for the upgrade.

Works as expected, though ads are not vetted for deceptive practice. Most ads have a big call-to-action button beneath them, either "Open" or "Install". This button is not an obvious part of the ad and schemed to look like a functional part of the app. When showing the "Open" button, it is entirely too easy to confuse with a button that would open the link decoded from the barcode. Although the ad is labeled as such, it needs to be visually framed. Until that happens, this app is deceptive.

Similar complaint as other users have said. When I scanned a QR, it brought up two links. One link with a big blue button that was actually an ad. The other link which was the one I wanted, was much more inconspicuous. I was in a rush trying to pay for parking. I accidentally opened the ad link thinking it was to pay for parking. I foolishly filled out the form and entered my credit card info. Now, my bank account has been hacked because the link is a scam site. 1 star for hosting a scam.

Downloaded at the moment I needed it. Developer must have known that to be something that happens often cause as soon as I opened the app it went straight to the camera, ready to scan. It was easy to scan the QR code and it returned the result lighting fast. I was given options on what I wanted to do (open the weblink, share the link or what-have-you) and when I touched the "open link" button, I was quickly moved to the exact correct target for that link. Worked great!! Love it.

It works as described. I do have a problem with the way the advertisements are set up on the page after you scan a qr code. Like other people have said, there is a blue "open" button between the picture of the code and the address, that looks like it will open up the link you scanned. It instead opens up an advertisement link in your browser. I don't believe it is an intentional scam, but it is definitely an issue that needs to be addressed. It is on this app, no mistake (like support has said).

I don't care for the way the ads are presented after scanning a code: Ads are in the middle of the screen, with a large blue button, while the actual scanned link is an inconspicuous url at the top. I feel like this intentionally misleads users into clicking on the ads, and I will be uninstalling because of it. The scanning capability itself works fine.
data.replyText: We are sorry for this, but to continue work on this free app we need revenue from Ads. If you don't want to see the Ads you can purchase the Pro version. Thanks for your understanding!

data.text: It did not work. On first attempt, it detected entirely different barcode. 2nd attempt, it would not detect the barcode at all. It would never focus. Apparently it is not compatible with my Stylo 4 phone's camera. I uninstalled it. It may be great for some but totally wasted my time. Btw, I was scanning same bar code each time. Sorry for bad review. It just didn't work for me.
data.replyText: We have not had this issue reported to us before, and we'd certainly like to work this through for you. Could you share the details at gammaplay.com@gmail.com? And any relevant screenshots would be immensely valuable. Thank you.

data.text: This app absolutely exceeded my expectations! I thought it was going to be a pain like most other scanners that I've used, but this one is amazingly fast! It even scans the QR code instantly, practically before you can even get your camera in focus, and sends you to a consistently accurate address! I've tested it repeatedly. It's amazing!

Worked for me nothing is wrong with it and it's free! I love the feature where it can scan a file that you screenshoted or downloaded a qr code. It helped me with what I needed it to do so I would really recommend this app for everyone! Just it had a black screen but if I needed to scan it and it was not on the screen I could just use a different device, like a phone.

I had to scan a QR code for an appointment but my phone's camera wasn't connecting. I downloaded this "free" app and a screen popped up for credit card info. I was in a hurry so I input my debit card info thinking it was a free trial thing I could cancel before my card was charged. It appears that the charge was for some gaming app because a charge for $39.99 then $2.99 immediately showed up on my bank account. Very scammy. Be careful!
data.replyText: Hi, you must be confusing our app with similar one with similar name. This app is 100% free and has no subscriptions and no in app purchases. Please check who you paid to and update your rating related to this app.

data.text: The first QR code that I scanned retrieved the wrong item. Another app that I used did scan the correct result from the same QR code. In the meantime, I got very, very noisy popup ads, almost at every touch. You certainly cannot use this app in a quiet zone of any kind. Shame if you forget to turn off the media sounds, which you most like will do sooner or later.. App not recommended.

BEWARE. Same thing as others have said, the ads are vague. I downloaded this QR scanner to scan a qr code on the side of the router I got them clicked on an ad thinking it was the link to start my intertet up. I input the card info for the "free" account, which was kind of weird looking back, but next thing I know my bank sends me a text saying they blocked a transaction of $39.99 immediately after I tried creating the "free" account. The Ads are scams. Choose a different app.

DO NOT USE THIS SCANNER!- This is connected to scamming companies! I used it to reactivate a PBS account on Roku and when I clicked a link on my phone it took me to something that was not PBS (I didn't realize that). I stupidly gave my credit card number and they said my account would not be charged. It was charged right away. When I try to login to their website it does not allow me to. I've had to lock my debit card and go through the process of changing all my billing accounts. BEWARE!!
data.replyText: HI, app is 100% free, has no in app purchases or subscriptions. Maybe you are confusing this app with some scam app that has same or similar name.

data.text: BUYER BEWARE!! I got hacked 3 times since July 31 while using this app ~ twice when I attempted to activate my new ATM replacement cards. At first I attributed the hacks to when I was attempting to sign up for streaming services on my smart tv. But after this morning's hack, there's no question in my mind that whether or not your phone has security installed (mine does), this is NOT a safe app to use.

The app works well. It does what you expect. Other peoples reviews helped me to avoid the pitfalls... when you scan a qr code the text link appears at the top and the image of the qr code appears at the bottom. In between there is an open button. Other reviewers have said the open button does not open the website of the qr code. It opens some other advertising. So I stay away from the open button. Touch the hyperlink text that appears at the top for the web page of the qr code and you'll be ok.

The positioning of the ad block right after a scan sets up a dark UX pattern, where the blue "Open" button on the ad is more easily seen (and clicked) than the real Open action. Some ads then prompt for payment, which is just ridiculous to allow. Move the ad block to visually disassociate it from the code that was just scanned, not right next to it.

The app is very quick and, in my opinion, intuitive. My reason for the 4 star instead of 5 star rating is the placement of the scanned barcode image below the ad. The decoded text of the barcode is at the top, and the barcode image should be placed next. Instead, an ad comes next (no criticism of the advertisement, dev has to be paid for their work) with an Open button. This arrangement implies that the Open button is pressed to see search results, but it opens the ad.

Was trying to sign up for a limited time thing, and downloaded this to use the QR image. The ads are deceptive and was just vague enough for me to believe it was the correct website. I put in my email/phone number and have been inundated with spam calls/emails non-stop, even 2 am. They could've set it up in a way that clearly indicates you are viewing a different website than the one you wanted, but they probably make more money if you trust them and fill out the ad. Use any other qr scanner
data.replyText:
Dear User,
We apologize for this experience. We would need to speak with you to better understand the problem you encountered. Please contact us at gammaplay.com@gmail.com so we can help resolve this issue. Thank you.

data.text: Two stars for being free and functional. However, I will uninstall. Placement of ads tricked me into clicking the wrong thing when I wasn't paying close attention. "Advertiser" was really a scammer that collected my credit card info when I was trying to buy tickets from the QR code. Had to report fraud and get a new card. Developer either needs to police the advertisers or make the ads more clearly separated from scan results.
data.replyText: Hi, please send us screenshot of any scam ads and we will make sure they are removed. It is impossible for us to check all ads manually. We serve ads from Google ad network Thank you!

data.text: Ads are scams! I was attempting to pay a restaurant bill, and instead of the restaurant opening up, the ad did. It took my information and now is billing me 49.95 for something I didn't order or have access to. Be aware that the app allows ads that are scams. In response to your response. BULL. I am not stupid to mix up apps. That is insulting. I maintain my statement.
data.replyText: You must have mixed it up with a similar app. App is indeed completely free to use, and there are no subscriptions or hidden fees. Rest assured that you can enjoy all the features and benefits of this app without any cost. Feel free to explore and make the most of it!

data.text: I needed to test barcodes printed on an older HP Envy printer at home. QR & Barcode Scanner worked flawlessly on the first try. Quick and consistent. I especially liked that it wasn't trying to find the barcodes on the Internet automatically, thought there are options to search for or share the text. Nicely done app; it's a keeper.

***WARNING*** I don't know when this started, but I used this app at a restaurant, and after scanning the barcode there was a link that popped up affiliated with the restaurant, but directly below the image was another link that was an ad (apparently served by Google Ads) which can be easily confused with the correct URL. If you follow that link, they will take your numbers and start subscribing you to bogus "web service" sites. I had to cancel 2 cards!
data.replyText:
Dear User,
We apologize for this experience. We would need to speak with you to better understand the ad you encountered. Please contact us at gammaplay.com@gmail.com so we can prevent misleading 3rd party ads from appearing in our apps. Thank you.

data.text: The way this app is set up makes you click on ads instead of the QR Code destination. I got scammed when I clicked on the link given to me by the DMV and it asked me for my credit card information right off the bat. I thought that this was a HUGE upgrade for the DMV to expedite payment. NOPE! It was a scam ad and the DMV QR Code was supposed to send a text message. Uninstalling since my bank was diligent enough to catch my error.
data.replyText:
Dear User,
Please be careful to open links from QR codes or ads you do not know. Do not trust anyone asking for your credit card details. Take care!

data.text: The app itself works great, but the way ads are served is incredibly misleading. After scanning a QR code you are shown the address the code wants to take you to, as well as a big blue button labeled OPEN which doesn't actually open the link-- it takes you to an extremely sketchy ad instead which feels designed to harvest data. In response to the developer-- plenty of apps show ads in ways that don't feel deliberately misleading.
data.replyText: Hi Ari, we are so sorry about the ads. We need ads to pay for the development of our apps. You can also purchase ads free version of the app for the price of small coffee and help us finance further development this way. Thank you ‚ù§Ô∏èÔ∏è

data.text: I received a special offer for one of my cc's; to activate I was about to go and log onto the home PC when I saw the QR code. I clicked on this app & it scanned the code, located the page & activated the offer in seconds! I didn't even finish focusing the camera - it was fast, clear, & intuitive! A great app for anyone to use in seconds! Thanks to the developer!!

Scam alert! Don't click the ad on accident! I scanned the QR code to activate my credit card and a button in the middle of the screen said "Open" with the word "Activate" above it looked like the way to open the link but it was a link to a scam! I didn't realize it until I had put in my card info and even though I cancelled, it tried charging my account as soon as it was activated.

Has questionable reviews will have one star, but say excellent or good Tricks you into signing up for something! I'm still not sure what I inadvertently signed up for. Like others I thought I was clicking the link for which I scanned the barcode (I questioned it in my mind at first but stupidly filled out the info including my cc information because i was trying to pay a restaurant bill. Now, I am having to cancel my card because there is no way to delete the account I unintentionally created.
data.replyText: I'm sorry for any confusion, but this app is indeed completely free to use, and there are no subscriptions or hidden fees. You must have mixed it up with a similar app. Rest assured that you can enjoy all the features and benefits of this app without any cost. Feel free to explore and make the most of it! üòäüÜì

data.text: I was happy with it until I used it to scan something and an ad popped up. I thought the ad was a part of what i scanned and ended up using my debit card, and now i have issues because now my debit card is attached to a membership i didn't even scan for... Like why do these apps allow these ads. I can never understand, so now i don't even want to use the app because of the sneaky ads.... Just pointless and useless
data.replyText:
Dear User,
We apologize for this experience. We would need to speak with you to better understand the problem you encountered. Please contact us at gammaplay.com@gmail.com so we can help resolve this issue. Thank you.

data.text: Keeps bringing me to a site that wants me to register for some kind of media site. I just want to scan and open the page that is associated with the product that I scanned. It's that simple. I've tried other scanner apps and had the same issue. Once in a while it actually does what it's supposed to do. More like a scammer app than a scanner app. Terrible
data.replyText: Sorry we are not responsible for contents of QR codes. You need to talk to company that made it.

data.text: Works but has bad predatory ads that are for other products, but it makes you think you need to register to use this app. Ad review is the responsibility of the dev and these ads are very bad. Edit:I'm not confused. The ads in the app say "Register now!" and would make less tech savvy people think you need to register. Very bad ad management on the devs behalf.
data.replyText: Hi Sev, you must be confusing this app with another with similar name. You do not need to register to use this app. Please check.

data.text: I read some bad reviews, i wanted to try this app and guess what it works on almost every qr and barcode. From books to grocery to medicine and even on little torn barcode. If you can't find thing on product search go for web search well if you can read and know how to use app. 4 stars because for some plastic wrapped things it shows boxed ones. Great app keep it up. Beep is little annoying but thanks to developer you can turn it off and for ads its not annoying just takes some unused space.

I was scammed by the advert that came with the reader when I used it. I thought that I was being asked to create an account with the restaurant in which I was ordering a meal. I paid ¬£1 deposit. This was then followed by two (so far) payments taken for different expensive subscription services. I had not authorized these and don't want them. Credit card had to be cancelled. Still haven't got my money back.
data.replyText: This doesn't seem right. We serve ads by Google AdMob. Please report this advertiser to us. Please send a note to gammaplay.com@gmail.com so we can connect.

data.text: First time using this scanner app. I have used several scanner apps. None of them work well.Didnt give the information after scanning the code.. I gave up on scanner apps.. I needed to find another scanner app so I could link my cell to my laptop computer.I thought here we go again. Another scanner app.. I scanned the barcode on the computer.I was amazed it instantly linked my cell onto the laptop. Awesome, ser-friendly. Deserves 5 stars and more.

BEWARE As others have said the app leads to adverts initially not the intended location and in my case something called ffitbill tried to take ¬£60 out of my account without authorisation. Luckily my bank flagged the transaction as suspicious and suspended my card. I have since had other communications via email about a free trial and monthly subscriptions luckily also stopped. Beware this app may leed to fraudulent access to your bank or credit cards. I recommend not to use this app.
data.replyText: This doesn't seem right. We serve ads by Google AdMob.

data.text: Doesn't work & is deceptive. Unlike other comments, all it shows me is a blue OPEN button that opens an ad. I can't find anywhere on the screen where the URL link might be displayed. Removing it.

If I have to go through your 100 odd venders at least have a reject all button. Don't make people have to click on each one to hopefully catch out the lazy people that press accept all, and a lot of people would move onto a separate app that allows them to click reject all. Noy a good interface for people's privacy.
data.replyText: Hi, consent form is EU requirement and its shown by google the way EU law requires it. Please complain to EU as we are all annoyed by it.

data.text: What a scam! I was trying to access content on the TV channel my5 and on grabbing the QR code I was duped into clicking through to a website to 'activate', with the promise of a month's trial for ¬£1. Once I'd paid my pound I found it had nothing to do with Ch 5 but was a gaming website, and the trial turned out to be ONE DAY, after which I would be charged ¬£59.95!! Thank heavens I cancelled immediately! Watch out, the 'Open' link on the big blue bar directly underneath is not it! Be careful!
data.replyText: Hi, please use common sense when scanning QR codes. Scammers keep using them more and more each year. If you scan a QR code that should be a restaurant menu and it is not, do not simply give credit card data if asked. Next to app name you can see this app has no in app purchases and it is 100% free. There are many apps with same or similar name.

data.text: This Barcode works rapidly, and without any glitches whatsoever. I honestly haven't used the app to it's fullest capabilities. Not too worry. I'll post once again when I have. The Ancient One ü§ì

I'm fine with apps needing ads to get revenue, but this app's ad format borders on fraudulent. Every ad has a large, easy to tap "Open" button whih is made to mislead the user into tapping the ad instead of tapping the link you just scanned.
data.replyText: This doesn't seem right. We serve ads by Google AdMob. Please report this advertiser to us. Please send a note to gammaplay.com@gmail.com so we can connect.

data.text: I have had many Tens machines, in the past for my back, and this one is perfect no wires just sitting there. This one has a remote control and very easy to use, thank you so much, I am wearing the tens machine already, I only got it on the 4/1/24 brilliant machine.

It's very fast within 1 seconds it's shows the details we need,to be informed. App is very nice very well working so, given the amount need to be rated. And also the gives the option to create qr code for any other many things, thanks to all.

I was scammed using this app whilst unsuccessfully trying to order food from my seat at a theatre. I was debited ¬£1, then a further ¬£59.99 the following day. The bank have refunded me, the venue informed me they are aware of multiple other incidents, as stated on here, and that the issues are related to the QR app site used. I have deleted it from my phone.

It is a good app but sometimes it can't scan some small QR codes like on medicines , Colgate, books etc. Iam not telling that it does not work Iam telling sometimes it doesn't work that is the problem that's why I don't like this app and also I have given only 2 stars for this feature of this app.

I love this app. üòÄ we can scan each and everything thing from this app in some phones there is no scanner whenever we want Paytm or scan something we face many problems but from the day I downloaded this app my all problems of scanning was vanished ü§óü§óüå∏
I've had no issues with this app. No bugs, no issues. It serves its purpose as I need a QR scanner for my timesheets as well as looking up different applications

Scan the QR code on the icon image. You'll be more surprised than me to find out the weirdest thing you can find there. Like, I wasn't expecting it to lead to a website, but it still lead to something pretty cool. üòè

Honestly speaking, I didn't expect many features in very small sized app. I strongly recommend this app to every user as this thing is unbelievable and very useful with high productivity. And yes, clearing reader's doubt I am using this since a year and wasn't paid for this review this is my honest experience.

I don't appreciate that when I scan a barcode it goes automatically to an ad that I don't want to use ever. I do understand that is how they pay for their service but it is not necessary to force someone to click on aN ad before we can access the information we need.

I am a VERY low tech guy. I NEED considerable help with the simplest things. I have to be told or shown what my mistakes are when I use or misuse an App to get to where I wish. This app took me to a wrong place scanning a code I believed was something else I didn't know if I'd done something wrong or the failure belonged to the code I scanned or this app. With that confusion I am unable to try again

I know these things are generally the same, however for people like me that have issues with handicap issues from illnesses with vision and stuff or doing things just mentally because it doesn't connect with neurological illnesses this one has a button click right on it and goes to the side a lot of the other ones you don't know where you're going to end up if you don't click

It IS self explanatory, IF you're familiar with QR code's & how to scan, HOWEVER, thinking of those who aren't so well versed (I ask myself "Could Momma do this without calling me for help?") THEN this app could use a bit of instruction, perhaps labels that says "PICK THIS üëàüèº IF you just want to go to the site" & "PICK THIS üëáüèº IF you want to bookmark & check it out later" etc. I don't say this as a complain, I say it as a suggestion for consideration of the easily frustrated (Mommaü•∞)

Apps itself works fine, but the ads they run will trick you into clicking on them thinking they're part of the qr code your scanning and try to get you to enter credit card info. I got my card stolen this way. Stay away until they stop allowing these shady and deceptive ads on their platform.
data.replyText: Oh no! We sincerely apologize for the troubles you've had with the app. We'd be happy to take a look into this for you, please contact us at gammaplay.com@gmail.com. Thank you.

data.text: Went shopping and I scanned the barcode for a product. Well, it went like this.......after scanning, it took me a weird search page with nothing about the product. Uninstalling now.

Good app. I can see a lot of people complaining that the app is misleading and links to scams. This almost discouraged me from installing it, but my personal experience is that it is simple and straightforward to use and I liked it.

A perfect tool for scammers. Of course don't pay attention to the second area just because it says open...oh, going back, yes, the dreaded small print. Yea, you got me. Thought I had this stuff figured out. Nope

This is so easy to use, even when I'm across the room, reading the QR code on the TV to add a streaming channel with ease. I was always doubtful about QR's, but this app rocks! Only one I'll ever use. Thanks y'all.
Auto scan doesn't read correctly. Edit: there needs to be a manual button. The image would grab but grab as I was moving the QR code to the center of the screen.
data.replyText: Hello, can you share more details about your problem at gammaplay.com@gmail.com?

data.text: Excellent app I am impressed just bowled out. Use this app if you really want to use QR Scan App then this is something for you. Thank you very very much Team for creating such a fantastic user friendly app. All the best and may you reach the pinnacle of success in the coming days.

Since the developer completely missed the point about how the QR codes I scanned were not random QR codes handed to me by a stranger let me rephrase this. The QR codes were at legitimate places. The QR codes were on official websites or at local places as a way to sign waivers to use said establishment. The QR app then gave me a address to click on to go to that was an attempt to steal credit card information. No wonder he doesn't charge for this app he gets his money from the scam sites.
data.replyText: Hi, please use common sense when scanning QR codes. Scammers keep using them more and more each year. If you scan a QR code that should be a restaurant menu and it is not, do not simply give credit card data if asked. Next to app name you can see this app has no in app purchases and it is 100% free. There are many apps with same or similar name.

data.text: It use to work great but I am trying to scan the code on a shower door and it keeps opening up Easter baskets or women's gold watches. Really frustrating.

Deceptive ads thought I was downloading a different app. This app Came up as top result in a search for transparency app. When I scanned a QR code this app didn't recognize it served me an ad for another app to "register " that's when I noped out.

Your problem needs more detailed examination. Please report it to our technical support team at gammaplay.com@gmail.com. We are always looking to help our users.

data.text: This app is quite professional and extremely knowledgeable. I really appreciate it and no knowledge I'm capable of understanding how to go about scanning because I usually depend on others. Now I realize I'm independent of what I'm capable of understanding and doing better today. Hope I will be able to refer or explain it to my parents or siblings. I could let my friends know I was grateful to have doing what I understood scanning is extremely important and and easy. Now I capable of scanning
It is a great qr code scanner. idk about barcodes but, still. It is a great scanner for qr codes. It reads the qr codes perfectly fine. 10/10 Would recommend.
Its not giving me that crochet video i need, unaccurate, if i could i would do 1 half stars, dont fall for it, i tried to scan more than one time and its still not accurate.

I have great experience with PPS , I used to provide my car for every issue here and they undertake all the works with utmost accuracy and perfection, they carry on all works to entire satisfaction of customer, I am completely satisfied, in all aspects PPS is outstanding

I clicked on the advertisement by accident instead of clicking the link where I was supposed to pay for my laundry machine. Who wouldn't press the big blue button instead of some text. Do you get a cut of the money that I lost?
Absolutely amazing app, also the fact that you can use image to scan without the need to pointing your camera toward QR code is just amazing.
It was such a beautiful network connection tool between my phone and my laptop . Has never been this easy to instantly get laptop web into my phone at a barcode signal.
It's so convenient. Most everything has a qr code. I'm old school however I do find this odd looking square box with squiggles very helpful. What next, I ask myself.

Gave me a fake link that nearly scammed me while activating a sim card until I had already gave them an email and realized what was going on. Already bad enough I need to download an app for a function that should be supported on every phone but this is completely asinine.

I hope to copy my barcode scanner are copying or sending qr and barcodes with my files. Great!
Works excellent, beware i don't use it to open links, just to read the passwords of wifi networks

Was very insprintual. It's right to give him thanks and praise's. For I learned today That God has a place in my heart now and forever,and it is right to give him thanks and praise's through-out the day. Hes always listening and there for me. 24/7

I put my debit card in & it charged me $2.00. Now it's asking for my card again & it says it's a problem & won't let me get back into the app. This app is a RIP OFF & I WANT TO BE REALEASE BACK TO MY ACCOUNT. FREE MY A$$
I've recently gained an interested in scanning and saving barcodes for later use, so I thought I'd give this app a try. It's working great and I'll start using it from now on.
Opend, then I just moved it across the code and it opened it up immediately. Very fast scanner, works like a charm.
Very fast to link up. A bit slow for the "syncing ", & I am unable to sync older chats.
SCAM!! When downloading the app, the prompt stated I would not be charged, but required my card information. Was immediately charged $49.95, and had to cancel my card.
Reads first time every time. Does what it should do, easy to use. If you looking for a QR scanner try this one, you'll be happy with it
Very good but I scanned the QR code in my book It says 'no videos found' so please do anything i want to see the video. But the is working super.Thank youüíØüíØüëèüëèüëè
Best QR code scanner, FAST, RELIABLE, no pop-up ads, shows u the data, and let's you open it with the respective app, 10/10!
Its an amazing QR scanning app not gonna lie it's quick an steady - meaning the app can read the QR code in many situations,like walking an scanning a code it still captures very good
I've used this app for a long time and it works . And they really have made improvements to it because now it's really fast it works well give it a try and you'll see
